fields.name: Penguin Random House
fields.description: One of the world's largest English-language trade book publishers.

fields.name: Simon & Schuster
fields.description: A major American publisher best known for publishing popular books, magazines and digital content.

fields.name: HarperCollins
fields.description: One of the world's largest publishing companies, with a diverse range of books, including fiction, non-fiction, and children's products.

fields.name: Hachette Livre
fields.description: A French publisher that is one of the largest publishing groups in the world, with imprints in many countries.

fields.name: Macmillan Publishers
fields.description: A global trade publishing company that publishes books, magazines, textbooks, and more.

fields.name: Bloomsbury Publishing
fields.description: A British independent publisher that has won multiple awards and publishes books in many genres.

fields.name: Scholastic Corporation
fields.description: An American multinational publishing, education and media company known for publishing educational materials for schools, teachers, and parents.

fields.name: Houghton Mifflin Harcourt
fields.description: An American publishing company that publishes textbooks, instructional technology materials, assessments, reference works, and fiction and non-fiction for both adults and young readers.

fields.name: Alfred A. Knopf
fields.description: An American publishing house that was founded in 1915 and is now part of the Knopf Doubleday Publishing Group, which is a division of Random House, itself a subsidiary of Penguin Random House.

fields.name: Farrar, Straus and Giroux
fields.description: An American publishing company that was founded in 1946 and is now a division of Macmillan Publishers, itself part of the Holtzbrinck Publishing Group.
